intro: Mastichodendron microlobum, commonly known as the small-leaf mastichodendron, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other well-known plants like the cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the summer. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically consumed by various bird species. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
